comments.body:
Casting the other way around would be safer, but unlikely to be worthwhile.

As an aside - I think we almost always use `np_intp` instead of `Py_ssize_t`, even if the latter is more correct. Perhaps we should do the same here.

Below you also seem to use `np_intp`

I just copied the return type of `PyTuple_GET_SIZE`. I suppose we could cast it to `size_t`, which is what was happening before, OTOH, I already know the size of `terms` and that the cast is safe. I'd probably just cast it to `int` myself.
